issue.title: crowdin.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://crowdin.com/profile](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcrowdin.com%2Fprofile) ### Comment > When the AdGuard extension is enabled, parts of the Crowdin website's UX/UI are blocked as ads even though they are not ads. > > Please fix this. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.net/sitereports/n3ryr2ythf4sso4ksgwgwgcck4sg0k0mw80xtryb1c.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.net/sitereports/800a9rk81wg0o8g8skcscwcgck8o0ks4ij8m89iy7w.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Browser Extension v5.2.400.0 MV2 System version: | `Windows 11` Browser: | Edge Tracking protection: | **General settings**:
Block trackers,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header

**Tracking methods**:
Self-destructing third-party cookies (2880)

**Miscellaneous**:
Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads,
EasyList

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection,
AdGuard URL Tracking,

uBlock Origin – Badware risks

comment.body:
- @dmitriivqa39

Please fix the Crowdin issue as soon as possible. I cannot complete the translation of Adguard projects.
